{"id":932323513,"question_id":2696,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 year, 2 months","timestamp":1681280050,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/932323513/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"The Number of Beautiful Subsets","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\n    public int beautifulSubsets(int[] nums, int k) {\n        \n        Arrays.sort(nums);\n        \n        Set<List<Integer>> set = new HashSet<>();\n        \n        helper(nums, k, new ArrayList<>(), set, 0);\n    \n        // for(List<Integer> list : set){\n        //     System.out.println(list);\n        // }\n        \n        \n        return set.size();\n    }\n    \n    private void helper(int[] nums, int k, List<Integer> list, Set<List<Integer>> set, int st){\n        \n        if(list.size()>0)\n            set.add(new ArrayList<>(list));\n        \n        for(int i=st; i<nums.length; i++){\n            \n            int n = nums[i];\n            if(list.size()==0 || !list.contains(n-k)){\n                \n                list.add(n);\n                helper(nums, k, list, set, i+1);\n                list.remove(list.size()-1);\n            }\n        }\n        \n    }\n    \n    \n    \n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"the-number-of-beautiful-subsets","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
